Reviews.Title: “Room Clean but ???”
Reviews.Author: GordonFScott
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate for sleeping and watching a little TV, but the staff was not real helpful and there was no coffee until 8am. Also, breakfast was not much at all. Price was only about $12 cheaper than a Holiday Inn right now the street. Next time I will stay at the Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Don't take a second look!”
Reviews.Author: virgo9586
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were looking for a place to stay for the night. We decided to stop at this place. The people at the front desk were nice. When we got to the room, it looked pretty decent....until we pulled the covers back. There were holes in the sheet and stains on one side of the pillows. Also, the pillows were very flat. Upon leaving, we noticed an empty potato chips bag behind the nightstand. Also, the tub was dirty! I will neveer stay here ever. Stay at the Days Inn which is closer to 76 or just go near the airport if you want a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Inn was terrific. Will stay there the next time I'm in PA.”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneTravels
Reviews.Content: Four of us, all women, each had our own room. The rooms were BIG and we could easily have shared. The staff was welcoming, courteous and thoughtful. Our rooms were near the entrance from the well-lite parking lot so we didn't have to walk down long hallways. They did it automatically, without our having to ask. The things most important to me about the room itself is that it be quiet and have a good bed. The rooms scored 'excellent' in both categories.

Reviews.Title: “Management doesn't care, false advertising”
Reviews.Author: russianpostman
Reviews.Content: No WiFi! They advertise free WiFi, but on our visit Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday it could not be accessed. The four people working the front desk indicated it was a common problem (many others regularly complained) that only the manager could address. But he didn't. None seemed to care. They seemed most sorry for themselves for receiving so many complaints. Even though we paid in full for our stay on our credit card prior to its start, we had to get dressed in the night to go make a cash deposit of $10 for local calls. Then we had to go back again to pay $5 so that we could make a long distance call, even though they had our credit card number. There is a big flat screen TV, but no breakfast, no refrigerator, no coffee pot, no alarm clock, no microwave and worst of all no positive attitude toward service. The first morning we found ourselves standing in 6 inches of water during our showers. They fixed that and broke the shower. They offered to change our room. We asked and received permission to check out 1.5 hours late, but the manager told us we could have an hour. When checking out we asked for some consideration for all the inconvenience. The manager. Mr. Patel, sat in his office 10 feet away with the door open and didn't even come out or acknowledge us as we complained to the front desk. Given I could hear him clearly speaking to the front desk through his open door, I finally went into his office and told him, "Wouldn't it make more sense to come speak to us face to face?" We were told we deserved no consideration because WiFi is free, we had used a $10 off coupon from the internet at check in and he was kind enough to allow us to check out 1 hour late without charging us $25 as is hotel policy. Worst of all was management's attitude, "I have been here for 25 years. Go ahead and complain." He refused to give us contact information so that we could complain to the corporation.

Reviews.Title: “worst place to stay”
Reviews.Author: philytraveler
Reviews.Content: if you like constant noise, doors slamming, hookers in the hallway. pot smell, this place is for you.also plan on not getting any sleep. the noise and people in the hallways is non-stop.i can't believe that ther could be so many rude, crude, and obnoxiuos people gathered in one place. and management doesn't care, i stayed at this place last year, and figured i'll give it another try. big mistake, i checked out a day early it was so bad!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't even pause at this place”
Reviews.Author: Stonewall112
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice, is the thick bullet proof glass that the clerk sits behind at the check in desk. It is located in what I would consider a bad part of town. I stayed there for four nights and had no other choice but to continue my stay. The TV kept going in and out and the reception was bad. Most of the restaurants nearby did not appear to be any better than the hotel. The rooms were clean though. And the listed bar and restaurant was only open two days out of the week. I will not be staying at this location if I have to travel in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised... would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: blustarz
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant after reading the reviews, but pleasantly surprised once I checked in and saw the accommodations. The price was right, the neighborhood was fine and more importantly, the place was clean. What do you expect in Northeast Philadelphia?? If you want a nice, affordable place to stay for the night, you can't go wrong. If you want to spend a fortune for a room, pay for parking and stay at a four or five star hotel, go to Center City. My only complaint was that someone was smoking pot in a (smoking) room down the hallway, but otherwise, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “no words to describe”
Reviews.Author: kimmy53176
Reviews.Content: Never Again!!!!!!!!!!!!! I called the hotel after reading the posted reviews, the manager told me the hotel had been totally remodeled. NOT!!!! rooms were filthy, our pipe on the bathroom sink busted and their way of fixing it was to send two cleaning women to place a bucket under it. there were prostitutes in the halls, no iron, dirty sheets. put us in a smoking room after requesting a non, b/c no other rooms were available b/c air conditioning was broke in half of the rooms. everything in the negative reviews are true!! Also, if you call they will tell you that it is the competition that is writing all this, that is what i was told about the other reviews. do yourself a favor, spend $20-30 more and get a decent room!!! Totally disgusting

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellor
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on the web, and took the chance on the Roosevelt, as the price and locations were right. It actually turned out to be a very nice surprise - for my (very reasonable) room rate, I got a room with what looked like new furniture, a big, comfortable bed, a clean bathroom and a big TV. The halls looked nice (it looks like they just put in new carpets in the hallways) with actual artwork on many of the walls. Overall, a pleasant surprise - a good hotel, a good location at a good price. I would most definitely recommend this to fellow travellors - it looks like after some difficult years that they've got their act together!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: cruz8
Reviews.Content: The room was awful, the rug was filthy, there were holes in the curtains and on the bedspreads, and the window was broken, not to mention the towels were dirty. There was no clock radio and no inhouse directory. The faculty had no personality, not welcoming at all and you hear everything from doors slaming to people talking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The "front desk" at this establishment resembles a gas station in a bad part of town. The management is behind glass, and there are ancient two-way mirrors in the foyer, giving one the impression that you need only wait a short time before the complimentary thorazine and straight jackets are administered to the "guests." The clerk told my sons and I that we were in one of the "renovated rooms" which gave me some hope. The room itself was clean, but it was bereft of even the smallest amenity. There was no phone book or any paper, pamphlet, pens, and the air conditioning was not working well. My youngest son (9) tried one of the beds and announced that he would be sleeping on the floor. My son's both said that the beds felt like woooden planks. I thought it was an idle threat, but he did indeed sleep on the floor that night. The next morning, I went looking tor the "continental breakfast." It appeared sometime after eight and was the result of one of the staff having made a trip to Dunkin Donuts, and a pot of coffee (no decaf available) with a lovely carafe of milk sitting in some ice. The second morning it appeared even later because no one seemed to be in charge of actually putting the donuts where we could get them. Desparate guests ventured into the kitchen to nab a donut for themselves, and coffee was not made until shortly before nine. While we were getting ready to check out, our bathroom ceiling began to leak profusely. Those are just the "highlights" of our experience, and we were double billed for the adventure to boot. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room after we complained”
Reviews.Author: fiestylady
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Roosevelt Inn last year. We liked the rates and the rooms looked nice on the website. Not to mention it was AAA approved. When we got there they gave us a room that was awful!! The room was small, the carpet was dirty and the walls had holes in them. It was a nightmare!! Finally, I complained at the front desk because I was know way In hell taking this room. The manager at the front desk told us he gave us the wrong room which Im not sure If I believe that or not. He gave us a newly renovated room with a king sized bed and large tv. The room was much nicer!! Everything was neat and clean. Totally brand new!! We decided to stay and had a wonderful vacation after that. My advice to anyone on this motel...make sure your getting your moneys worth and complain if you have too!!

HotelInfo.Name: Roosevelt Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 7600 Roosevelt Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19152
